We shoot the bastard.
If he doesn't surrender.

translation.ja: 〈お前らは ヒトラーを知らない〉

translation.en: If you did, none of you would be here.
What do you want from me?
A meeting with Chamberlain. Tonight.
translation.ja: 〈今夜 チェンバレンと 話したい〉

translation.en: Help me. Hugh. You're his secretary. Secretaries arrange meetings.
translation.ja: 〈協力してくれ 秘書なら手配できるだろ〉

translation.en: - But not secret meetings with you. - There has to be a way.
It's impossible. And what do you want to tell him?
translation.ja: 〈無理だし 会ってどうする気だ？〉

translation.en: What do you want to tell him?
That Hitler is a terrible man?
Trust me, he knows.
I can prove it.
Is that amusing to you?
I'd forgotten what you're like.
- You don't want to help me. - I can't. I can't.
translation.ja: 〈見捨てるのか〉 〈個人的に会う場を 設けるのは無理だ〉

translation.en: I can't! Not with a private meeting.
translation.ja: 〈個人的に会う場を 設けるのは無理だ〉

translation.en: But if you have information we should know about,
translation.ja: 〈だが知っておくべき情報が あるなら―〉

translation.en: I can try to arrange for the prime minister to see it.
translation.ja: 〈首相に伝えることは できるかも〉

translation.en: Before he signs anything?
I can try.
Yes.
Excuse me, sir. If you're done with the Stürmer, could I have it?
translation.ja: 〈その新聞ですが 読み終わりました？〉

translation.en: - Of course. - Yeah? And could I keep it as well?
- Of course. - Are you sure?
- Yes. - Thank you very much.
Don't look at it. Just put it under your arm, God damn it.
translation.ja: 見ないでさっさとしまえ

translation.en: - Right. Sorry. - You make a terrible spy, Hugh.
translation.ja: ごめん ひどいスパイだ 奥さんと家にいた方がいい

translation.en: - Sorry. - You should be at home with your wife.
translation.ja: ひどいスパイだ 奥さんと家にいた方がいい

translation.en: It's actually a relief to be away.
translation.ja: 正直 出張は息抜きだ

translation.en: Let me guess. She finds you distant.
translation.ja: さては 距離を感じると言われた？

translation.en: She says you don't let her in.
That's right.
Do something about that.
And finish your beer.
Will I see you again?
You know,
if you ever needed to get out, you'd be well looked after in London.
translation.ja: 出る必要があるなら ロンドンへ

translation.en: I'll never abandon Germany. Never.
translation.ja: 俺は決して国を見捨てない

translation.en: Top secret.
Berlin, 10th November 1937.
The Führer began by explaining that the question is one of space.
translation.ja: “総統はまず 空間の問題だと説明した”

translation.en: The German race comprises over 85 million,
translation.ja: “ドイツ民族は 8500万人を超えており”

translation.en: and this constitutes a more tightly- packed racial community than any other country.
translation.ja: “他のどの国よりも密集した 民族社会を構成している”

translation.en: The only remedy lies in the acquisition of living space.
translation.ja: “唯一の解決策は 生活空間の確保であり―”

translation.en: And this will only be solved by means of force.
translation.ja: “これは武力によってのみ 解決される”

translation.en: How's your afternoon, Herr von Hartmann?
Arduous, Frau Winter. And yours?
Well, I'm hanging in there.
- Did you meet with your English friend? - I did.
- And? - And we'll see.
Did something happen?
Yes, you could say that.
We have an agreement. An agreement for the immediate handover of the Sudetenland…
translation.ja: 〈ズデーテン地方を 我々に引き渡すことで…〉

translation.en: Congratulations, Schmidt. Excellent work.
Thank you.
…to the German Empire.
We'll get everything we wanted.
I thought it would take at least another day.
Yes, it would have if Chamberlain had had his way.
translation.ja: 〈チェンバレンが 厄介だった〉

translation.en: He wanted to wear down the Führer with the smallest details.
translation.ja: 〈細部を突いて 総統を参らせようとしてね〉

translation.en: - The man is a bean counter. - Have they signed already?
translation.ja: 〈細部を突いて 総統を参らせようとしてね〉 〈もう署名を？〉

translation.en: What? The treaties are being drawn up right now. They'll sign after dinner.
translation.ja: 〈今 書面を用意してる 署名は夕食後だ〉

translation.en: And straighten your tie.
The two of us have been invited to the dining room with the Führer.
translation.ja: 〈我々もディナーの席に 招待された〉

translation.en: - Oh, God. - What, Oh, God? Von Hartmann.
Herr von Hartmann, that's a great honour.
- Yes. - Quite right, Fräulein…
- Frau Winter. - Frau Winter.
Anyway, the English and the French aren't staying for dinner. They've lost their appetite.
translation.ja: 〈英仏は食欲が失せたようで ディナーには出ない〉

translation.en: - So we were asked to fill the ranks. - Dr. Schmidt!
Well, looks like I'm needed again.
- A narrow escape. - Thank you.
The Führer is vegetarian. Insists on meat not being served anywhere.
translation.ja: 総統は菜食主義者で どこでも肉は出ない

translation.en: - Does he? - Yes.
When I was at lunch at the Chancellery with all the high command,
translation.ja: 総統官邸での昼食で 出てきたのは―

translation.en: - they served Sellerieschnitzel. -
- Musso will have enjoyed that. - Yes, wouldn't he just?
translation.ja: ムッソリーニは喜ぶ 間違いない

translation.en: And afterward, I'm telling you, I went to a butcher's shop nearby. - Ordered two huge sausages. - Could be Wurst.
translation.ja: その後 近くの精肉店に行き ソーセージを注文したよ

translation.en: Yes. And I was just leaving the butcher's shop,
translation.ja: で 店を出ようとしたら 誰が来たと？

translation.en: when who should be coming in but Hermann Göring,
translation.ja: で 店を出ようとしたら 誰が来たと？ 飢えた顔をしたゲーリングだ

translation.en: - with a hungry look on his face? -
translation.ja: 飢えた顔をしたゲーリングだ

translation.en: - He was as famished as I was. - Sir, I--
Yes, not now, Legat.
Don't drink too much, von Hartmann. Just wet your lips.
translation.ja: 〈飲みすぎだ 唇を濡(ぬ)らす程度に〉

translation.en: We still have a lot of work ahead of us.
Tomorrow, the world will watch Munich and our translations.
translation.ja: 〈明日は我々の翻訳が 注目される〉

translation.en: Of course.
We can't afford any mistakes.
…he has some skill. He's not a bad negotiator.
Prime Minister, tomorrow morning,
translation.ja: 首相 明朝 母親たちが あなたに感謝するでしょう

translation.en: millions of mothers will be blessing you
translation.ja: 明朝 母親たちが あなたに感謝するでしょう

translation.en: for having saved their sons from the horror of war.
translation.ja: 息子を戦地に送らずに済むと

translation.en: Oh…
- Prime Minister. - Too kind.
- Can I have a word? - Not now.
- It's rather urgent. - Legat!
You really should go and rest before the signing, Neville.
translation.ja: 署名の前に休まれた方が

translation.en: I think I will take forty winks.
- I sent a sandwich up to your room. - Thanks so much, Horace.
translation.ja: 部屋に軽食が 助かるよ

translation.en: Legat. Will you just give the man a moment to breathe?
translation.ja: 首相には息抜きの時間が要る

translation.en: - Yes. - He's very tired. He's been up for 15 hours or more.
translation.ja: 朝も早くて非常にお疲れだ

translation.en: Yes, sir. Sorry.
Join us for supper.
All right.
- Excuse me. - Von Hartmann?
Where are you going?
Excuse me, my Führer. I'm needed for the translation of the agreement.
translation.ja: 〈失礼ながら 協定書の翻訳がありまして〉

translation.en: Come here.
I never forget a personal obligation.
For Germany, I am prepared to be dishonest a thousand times over.
translation.ja: 〈国のためなら何度でも 不正を働く覚悟がある〉

translation.en: For myself, never.
I'm no watch thief.
Thank you, my Führer.
To the good health of our dear Italian friends.
translation.ja: 〈イタリアの友人の 健康を祈って〉

translation.en: And to the Führer.
To the Führer.
One of the Italian delegates was saying how good the kitchen is.
translation.ja: イタリア代表団が 絶賛していた

translation.en: - Yes, indeed, yes. - What do you recommend?
- I recommend the Hachsen. - What is that?
It's a pork knuckle. Very crispy.
- Sir Horace! - Yes?
Would you mind if I joined you in a moment?
Yes, of course.
- Have you read it? - It's classified.
translation.ja: 読んだ？ 極秘文書だ　もし…

translation.en: - If they find… - Have you spoken to Chamberlain?
- Have you spoken to Chamberlain? - Keep your voice down!
translation.ja: 首相には話したか？ 声を抑えろ　まだだ

translation.en: - Thre's no linen. No linen. - Not yet.
translation.ja: 声を抑えろ　まだだ

translation.en: You know they're about to sign?
translation.ja: 彼らはこの後 署名を

translation.en: It isn't an easy thing to raise with him.
translation.ja: 首相に話すのは難しい

translation.en: - Then I'll do it. - Oh, for God's sake! Don't be stupid.
translation.ja: 俺が話す バカを言うな

translation.en: This is the last moment. Do you understand?
translation.ja: これを逃せば次はない

translation.en: I won't have it on my conscience that I did nothing!
translation.ja: 諦めたら良心がとがめる

translation.en: - I feel the same. As soon as I can-- - No, no.
- I'll talk to him. - Not soon, now!
- Let's do it together. - No!
- Why not? We are on the edge. - Do you have any idea--
translation.ja: なぜ？　もう後がない

translation.en: We are right on the edge.
Paul.
- I'm sorry. - What's happened to you?
translation.ja: すまない 何があった？

translation.en: We have to try, Hugh.
Please, we have to try.
translation.ja: 頼む　協力してくれ

translation.en: This'll be the end of my career.
Where's the document?
In my room.
Come on.
Is there another hotel nearby?
Downtown. I will call it. I will call.
translation.ja: 今 電話してみます

translation.en: Thank you, that would be great.
In the meantime, if we can get some linen so we can have a shower, that would be amazing.
translation.ja: あとシャワーを浴びたいから リネンの用意も

translation.en: Listen. He's old, and he's exhausted.
translation.ja: 首相は高齢で疲れ切ってる

translation.en: I'll give him the document, and if he agrees to see you,
translation.ja: 僕が書類を渡す 首相が面会に同意しても モラルは説かず事実だけ話せ

translation.en: for God's sake, don't give him a moral lecture.
translation.ja: 首相が面会に同意しても モラルは説かず事実だけ話せ

translation.en: - Just the facts. - All right.
translation.ja: 首相が面会に同意しても モラルは説かず事実だけ話せ 分かった

translation.en: Wait here.
Oh, sorry, Prime Minister.
No, no, no, no. Come on in, Legat. Just having my blood pressure checked.
translation.ja: 構わん　入れ 血圧を測ってるだけだ

translation.en: Fortunately, it looks as if I'll live another day.
translation.ja: 幸運にも まだ生きられそうだ

translation.en: - Good night. - Good night, Joseph. Thank you.
translation.ja: では どうもありがとう

translation.en: So what is it that can't wait? Hm?
We've come into possession of a significant document.
translation.ja: 重要な書類を入手しました

translation.en: And who is we?
I have come into possession of a document.
What is it?
The minutes of a meeting that Hitler held with his senior commanders last November.
translation.ja: ヒトラーが昨年 開いた会議の議事録です

translation.en: A meeting in which he explicitly commits himself to a war of conquest.
translation.ja: 征服戦争を行うと 明言しています

translation.en: Obviously, it's all in German, but I believe it to be legitimate and truthful.
translation.ja: ドイツ語ですが 本物だと思われます

translation.en: And how did this document come to us?
A friend gave it to me in strict confidence.
- Friend? - A German diplomat.
translation.ja: 友人？ ドイツの外交官です

translation.en: Why does he wish us to have it?
I think he should explain that himself. He's waiting outside.
translation.ja: 本人に説明させましょう 外にいます

translation.en: - Does Sir Horace know about this? - No, sir.
Nobody knows.
translation.ja: いいえ　誰も知りません

translation.en: You're exceeding your authority, young man.
I can't possibly meet with a German diplomat.
translation.ja: ドイツの外交官には会えん

translation.en: I understand, but he is risking his life to see you.
translation.ja: ですが彼も命を懸けてます

translation.en: No…
This is… most improper.
I'm aware, sir.
Right.
Three minutes. Not a moment longer.
You've got three minutes.
This is Paul von Hartmann of the German Foreign Ministry.
translation.ja: ドイツ外務省の ハートマンです どうも

translation.en: - How do you do? - Thank you for seeing me.
I'm not sure it's very wise. For either of us.
translation.ja: 双方にとって 賢明とは言えないがな

translation.en: Take a seat. Close the door, Legat.
translation.ja: かけたまえ ドアを閉めろ

translation.en: You better come and join us, Legat. Come on.
translation.ja: レガト　君もこちらへ

translation.en: So, get on with it.
That document is proof that Hitler is lying
translation.ja: この文書は― ヒトラーが領土要求の件で 嘘をついている証拠です

translation.en: when he claims to have no further territorial demands.
translation.ja: ヒトラーが領土要求の件で 嘘をついている証拠です

translation.en: On the contrary, he wants to expand the country,
translation.ja: 彼は今後も― 領土を拡大し続けたいと 考えています

translation.en: and he will keep on expanding.
translation.ja: 領土を拡大し続けたいと 考えています

translation.en: Therefore, I beg you not to sign the agreement tonight.
translation.ja: だから今夜 署名しないでください

translation.en: What?
Prime Minister.
Adolf Hitler is a monster.
He is a madman.
You cannot give him what he wants. He'll take more and more land.
translation.ja: 彼の要求をのめば さらに領土が奪われ―

translation.en: More and more people will suffer.
That is the proof.
I applaud your courage, young man.
translation.ja: 君の勇気は― たたえよう

translation.en: But I have to give you a lesson in political reality.
translation.ja: だが政治的現実を 分かってない

translation.en: The people of Great Britain will never take up arms over a local border dispute.
translation.ja: 国境紛争に関して 英国が武器を取ることはない

translation.en: - It's so much more than a local border-- - As for what Hitler may do
translation.ja: ただの国境紛争では… ヒトラーの動向については 様子を見る

translation.en: or may not do in the future, well, we shall have to wait and see.
translation.ja: ヒトラーの動向については 様子を見る

translation.en: - Wait and see is not-- - My sole objective here
translation.ja: ですが… この会談での私の目的は 目先の戦争を回避し―

translation.en: is to avert war in the immediate term,
translation.ja: この会談での私の目的は 目先の戦争を回避し―

translation.en: so I can begin to build a lasting peace.
translation.ja: 永続的な平和を 築くことだけだ

translation.en: - There will be no lasting peace. - But I have to try!
translation.ja: 平和などあり得ない だが努力せねば

translation.en: Look, the worst thing I could do is to walk away from this conference.
translation.ja: 最悪の選択は この会談から立ち去ることだ

translation.en: If you do, there are people waiting, high up in the military,
translation.ja: ヒトラー打倒を目指す 軍の高官たちは―

translation.en: a resistance, to bring him down.
translation.ja: あなたがそうするのを 待っています

translation.en: - Well, why haven't they done so already? - They will if--
translation.ja: なぜ待っている？ じき…

translation.en: I can't rely on some resistance
translation.ja: 君がその存在を信じる―

translation.en: you may believe exists in the German army.
translation.ja: ドイツ軍内の抵抗勢力など 頼れない

translation.en: Well, I…
think you should…
take this back to wherever it came from.
translation.ja: 元の場所に戻した方がいい

translation.en: No.
Keep it. Study it.
translation.ja: 手元に置いて学ぶといい

translation.en: That is the political reality.
Now you're being impertinent.
And you are shaking hands with a man who hates everything you stand for!
translation.ja: あなたが尊重するもの全てを 憎む男と握手を？

translation.en: He is lying to you. He will go further and further. He will not stop, sir. He will never sto--
translation.ja: 彼は嘘をついてる この先も決して止まらず…

translation.en: Thank you for your time.
Please don't sign the agreement.
Get rid of this.
I have to say, Legat,
I'm extremely disappointed in you.
translation.ja: 君には非常に失望した

translation.en: Mr. President of the Council. - Yes? - Thank you for your cooperation.
translation.ja: 〈閣僚評議会議長 ご協力に感謝します〉

translation.en: I think we have come to a very good agreement.
translation.ja: 〈おかげで 合意に達しました〉

translation.en: - Prime Minister. - Ah. Nice to see you.
Oh, Monsieur Daladier. Did you get some dinner?
translation.ja: ダラディエ議長 ディナーは？

translation.en: There they are.
…the Czechs aren't here, given the circumstances.
translation.ja: 〈状況的に チェコは呼ばない〉

translation.en: Um… Oh, there's Monsieur Daladier. I want to--
Mr. Daladier, how was your dinner?
translation.ja: 〈議長 ディナーはどうでした？〉

translation.en: - Sorry, we we both speaking. - Um, um… un sandwich?
- À tout à l'heure. - It is very exciting…
Are you looking for someone?
Yes, thank you. About the arrangements for the press? Who's responsible for that?
translation.ja: 〈報道陣の手配について 確認したい　責任者は？〉

translation.en: Enjoy the rest of your stay in Munich, Mr. Legat.
Oh bloody hell.
What did you want from him?
Can a British photographer be at the signing?
translation.ja: 〈英国の報道陣も 署名の場に〉

translation.en: No chance. Only the Führer's personal photographer has permission to take pictures.
translation.ja: 〈撮影できるのは総統専属の カメラマンだけだ〉

translation.en: I'm sorry if I embarrassed you tonight.
translation.ja: さっきはすまなかった

translation.en: I'm the one who should apologise.
What have you done with the document?
I will take it to London, find a more responsive audience.
translation.ja: ロンドンで他を当たってみる

translation.en: It won't be a waste.
- Gentlemen! - We should stop talking.
The Führer is pleased to invite you back to the library for the signing ceremony.
translation.ja: 総統が調印式のため皆様を 再び図書室へ招待します

translation.en: - Prime Minister. - Good.
Duce, Monsieur Président du Conseil, Excellencies, gentlemen.
translation.ja: 統帥 閣僚評議会議長 皆様もどうぞ

translation.en: Please, this way.
Who's there?
Open the door.
I want to show you something.
Now?
It's the only time we have.
Give me two minutes.
You can talk to her.
She won't respond, but maybe she can hear.
translation.ja: 反応はないが声は届くかも

translation.en: Lena?
It's me, Hugh.
What happened?
We split up.
After your trip to Munich.
translation.ja: お前が旅行に来た後に

translation.en: How did she end up here?
She was arrested at a protest in '35
and sent to Moringen, the women's camp.
translation.ja: モーリンゲンの 女子収容所に送られた

translation.en: When they discovered she was Jewish…
translation.ja: ユダヤ人だと知れると…

translation.en: they were rough.
They said she fell out of a window.
translation.ja: 窓から飛び降りたそうだ

translation.en: I'm sure she did.
But not before they carved a Star of David onto her back.
translation.ja: 背中には ダビデの星が彫られてた

translation.en: I knew he was racist.
All the awful Jewish stuff, I thought it could be put to one side.
translation.ja: 無視しても大丈夫だと 思ってた

translation.en: How?
But you can't put it aside.
If they are capable of that, they are capable of anything.
translation.ja: ユダヤ人を排斥できるなら 何でもできる

translation.en: Lena knew that.
Yes, she did.
May I?
Shall we share?
What will you do?
Carry on.
In a few hours, I have to present a press summary to Hitler.
translation.ja: この後 ヒトラーに 外国紙の要約を渡す

translation.en: I'm told he's taken a shine to me.
translation.ja: 俺を気に入ったらしい

translation.en: Maybe it's a chance to really do something.
translation.ja: 手を打つなら 絶好のチャンスかもな

translation.en: What do you…
- How? - It would solve everything.
translation.ja: それで全てが解決する

translation.en: They'd kill you for even thinking about it.
translation.ja: 考えただけでも殺されるぞ

translation.en: I have a pistol. I might get a moment alone with him.
translation.ja: 銃があるし 彼と２人きりになれるかも

translation.en: Stop it!
Don't be stupid.
I'll take the document to London. It will make a difference.
translation.ja: あの書類が流れを変える

translation.en: Probably more talking, yes.
- Yes, more talking. - I have to fight.
You don't have to fight!
We don't choose the times we live in.
translation.ja: 俺たちは 生きる時代を選べないが

translation.en: The only choice we have is how we respond.
translation.ja: どう生きるかは選べる

translation.en: - You don't have to fight, Paul! We don't. - I have to fight.
translation.ja: 必要なのは 戦いではなく対話だ

translation.en: - We need to talk! We need to-- - I… have to fight!
- No, you don't! No! - No! It's my responsibility! Understand?
translation.ja: ないよ 責任を果たせないなら―

translation.en: - Your responsibility? - Or I may as well blow my brains out.
There are other ways of doing things! Talk, discussion--
- There's no other things, no. - There's always hope!
translation.ja: いや　ないね 希望はある

translation.en: Hoping is waiting for someone else to do it. We'd all be much better off without it.
translation.ja: 誰かの助けを待てと？ 希望など持たない方がいい

translation.en: I'd miss you.
Goodbye.
Goodbye.
- Hello. - Hello.
Bit early for a walk.
Yes.
I-- I couldn't sleep. I had to clear my head.
translation.ja: 眠れなかったから 目を覚ましたくて

translation.en: Are you all right?
- Why are you standing out here? - I'm looking for you.
translation.ja: ここで何を？ あなたを捜してた 首相が呼んでる

translation.en: The PM's awake, and he wants to see you.
translation.ja: あなたを捜してた 首相が呼んでる

translation.en: - I heard you were looking for me, sir. - Ah! Legat. Good morning.
translation.ja: ご用ですか？ レガト　おはよう

translation.en: Don't suppose you brought that copy of The Times with… with Hitler's speech in it, did you?
translation.ja: ヒトラーの演説が載った タイムズ紙は持ってきたか？

translation.en: Yes, sir. I put it in your box, sir.
Oh, good man. Can you find it for me?
Had a word with him last night.
translation.ja: 昨夜 彼と話してね

translation.en: Asked if I might see him again this morning before we fly back.
translation.ja: 今朝 帰国する前に 会えるか聞いた

translation.en: - Asked who, sir? - Herr Hitler.
translation.ja: 彼とは？ ヒトラーだ

translation.en: Did-- did he agree?
Couldn't really refuse.
translation.ja: まあ 彼も断れまい

translation.en: Must say, that was a remarkably rude young man you brought to see me last night.
translation.ja: 昨夜 君が連れてきた男は 非常に失礼だった

translation.en: - I really am sorry about that, sir. - Ah, thank you.
translation.ja: 申し訳ありません ありがとう

translation.en: - Have you told anyone about it? - No.
translation.ja: 誰かに話したか？ いえ

translation.en: Good. Neither have I.
His arguments were naive,
translation.ja: 彼の考えは甘かったが―

translation.en: but… they were not ineffective.
translation.ja: 彼の考えは甘かったが― 効果がなかったわけではない

translation.en: Now, here we are.
translation.ja: 効果がなかったわけではない

translation.en: Listen, I'd like you to take this to Wilson.
Ask him to turn it into a short statement of intent.
translation.ja: 短い主旨書にまとめるよう 伝えてくれ

translation.en: Just from there to there.
Sir, I don't follow.
Well, on Monday night, Hitler publicly declared his desire
translation.ja: 月曜の晩 ヒトラーは公に断言した

translation.en: for a permanent peace between Germany and Great Britain.
translation.ja: 英独間の 永続的な平和を望むと

translation.en: - Yes. - Well, I'd like his undertaking redrafted.
translation.ja: はい だから彼に書き直してもらう

translation.en: - In the form of a joint statement. - A joint statement?
translation.ja: 共同声明の形にな 共同声明？

translation.en: To which both he and I can put our names this morning.
translation.ja: 今日の午前中 それに彼と私が署名する

translation.en: Oh, get on with it. Go on. Get it done.
translation.ja: ほら　早く持っていけ

translation.en: And get yourself a coffee. You're half awake.
translation.ja: あとコーヒーを飲んで 目を覚ませ

translation.en: We regard the agreement signed last night
translation.ja: “昨夜 署名した協定は 両国が二度と―”

translation.en: as symbolic of the desire of our two peoples
translation.ja: “昨夜 署名した協定は 両国が二度と―” “戦争をしないという願望の 象徴だと考えている”

translation.en: never to go to war with one another again.
translation.ja: “戦争をしないという願望の 象徴だと考えている”

translation.en: I hope the PM realises this has no legal force whatsoever.
translation.ja: 法的効力はないと 首相は理解を？

translation.en: - The man's not a fool. - What the hell's he playing at?
translation.ja: 当然だろう では なぜ？

translation.en: I've no idea. First I heard of it was half an hour ago.
translation.ja: さあ　私も30分前に聞いた

translation.en: - Do you have it? - Yes.
- Good. - It may be a little long.
translation.ja: よし 少し長いかも

translation.en: - What if he refuses to sign it? - Why should he?
translation.ja: 署名を拒まれたら？ まさか

translation.en: These are all statements he's made already.
It doesn't mean he's going to stick with them.
It's symbolic, Horace.
translation.ja: 象徴的だろ　ホレス

translation.en: Last night's agreement only settles a tiny dispute.
translation.ja: 昨夜の合意は小さな不和を 解決しただけだ

translation.en: There will be others.
And I want him to publicly commit himself to peace.
translation.ja: だから彼には公に 平和を約束してほしい

translation.en: Oh, Legat, make sure there's a car available at 11:00.
translation.ja: レガト　11時に車の手配を

translation.en: To the Führerbau?
No. Ah, you've put my name before his. It should be the other way around. Otherwise, good.
translation.ja: 彼の名前を上にしてくれ それ以外は問題ない

translation.en: Yes, I wanted to have a private meeting with him. Man to man, no officials.
translation.ja: そうだ 彼と２人きりで話したくてね

translation.en: - He invited me to his apartment. - What?
translation.ja: 自宅へ招待された はい？

translation.en: - No officials? - Not even you, Horace.
Oh, for God's sake. You can't go and see Hitler entirely on your own.
translation.ja: １人で彼に 会ってはいけません

translation.en: Can and will.
Gentlemen, we must rise to the level of events.
translation.ja: 我々も現在の出来事に 立ち向かわねば

translation.en: What? Hey!
What are you doing here?
I mean, what the hell are you doing here in Munich?
translation.ja: 〈ミュンヘンに 何をしに来た？〉

translation.en: What are you doing here in Munich? What's going on here?
What is going on here? Talk to me!
I don't know--
Now, let's talk. Come on. Talk to me!
I would suggest you go back where you came from.
translation.ja: 〈自分の国に帰った方がいい レガト〉

translation.en: Paul.
It was a specific point.
A bit of an embarrassment. Well, why was there…
translation.ja: きまりが悪いし なぜ…

translation.en: With respect to-- There just is. I can't explain it any more.
translation.ja: これ以上は説明できません

translation.en: - Prime Minister? - Yes?
- I should accompany you to the meeting. - No.
translation.ja: 私も同行を ダメだ

translation.en: I thought I had made this perfectly clear. No officials.
translation.ja: 役人は連れていかないと 言ったろ

translation.en: Not as an official, sir. As a translator.
No, I want him to feel this is a personal meeting.
You need someone there to make sure your words are accurately reported.
translation.ja: 言葉を正確に 伝える必要があります

translation.en: - I-- - Remember what happened at Berchtesgaden - when he refused to give us a copy… - No, that--
translation.ja: ベルヒテスガーデンでの 一件をお忘れで？

translation.en: You can't trust Schmidt to have your back.
translation.ja: シュミットは信用ならない

translation.en: I think a translator could be useful.
- I'm the only one who speaks German. - All right, all right, all right!
translation.ja: 私が適任です 分かったから もう黙れ

translation.en: You can come, but be discreet.
translation.ja: 同行を認めるが目立つな

translation.en: Keep out of his eyeline. And mine.
translation.ja: 彼や私の目に入らないように

translation.en: - - Mr. Chamberlain!
- Mr. Chamberlain! - Mr. Chamberlain!
Good morning, Prime Minister. - This way, sir. - Morning.
translation.ja: おはようございます こちらへ

translation.en: - Your wardrobe. - They have the document.
- Good morning. - Good morning.
- Did you sleep well? - Very well.
I'm pleased to hear that, sir.
We, the German Führer and British Prime Minister,
translation.ja: 我々 ドイツ総統と 英国首相は―

translation.en: are agreed in respect of the future of Anglo- German relations.
translation.ja: 英独関係の将来について 合意した

translation.en: We regard the agreement signed last night
translation.ja: 昨夜 署名した協定は 両国が二度と―

translation.en: as symbolic of the desire of our two peoples
translation.ja: 昨夜 署名した協定は 両国が二度と― 戦争をしないという願望の 象徴だと考えている

translation.en: never to go to war with one another again.
translation.ja: 戦争をしないという願望の 象徴だと考えている

translation.en: We are determined to continue to remove possible sources of difference
translation.ja: 我々は今後も可能な限り 相違の原因を取り除き―

translation.en: and to contribute to the peace of Europe.
translation.ja: 欧州の平和に 貢献していく所存だ

translation.en: Prime Minister, I would like to thank you explicitly.
I will accompany you back to your hotel.
translation.ja: 私がホテルまでお送りします

translation.en: Thank you, Herr Hitler.
And may I add
that there was never a doubt in my mind, sir,
translation.ja: 総統は国を守るためなら―

translation.en: as to the lengths to which you would go to protect Germany.
translation.ja: 何でもやると 私は決して疑わなかった

translation.en: The foreign press summary!
Thank you. Come along, Legat.
translation.ja: ありがとう 行くぞ

translation.en: The Reichsführer is arriving.
Please excuse me, my Führer.
The cheers for Hitler were mechanical and polite.
translation.ja: 〈“ヒトラーへの歓声は 機械的で丁寧だったが―”〉

translation.en: For Chamberlain, they were ecstatic.
translation.ja: 〈“チェンバレンには 熱い歓声が”〉

translation.en: You, as an educated German, what do you think? Are they right?
translation.ja: 〈教養あるドイツ人として 正しいと思うか？〉

translation.en: I do not wish to be followed mechanically!
translation.ja: 〈機械的な支持など 望んでいない〉

translation.en: I gave Germany back its dignity. Is it too much to ask for a little gratitude?
translation.ja: 〈国の尊厳を取り戻した私が 感謝を望むのは欲張りか？〉

translation.en: Mechanical.
They're grateful to this arsehole Chamberlain!
translation.ja: 〈チェンバレンに 感謝するとは〉

translation.en: Am I the only one who realises that we have a historic task ahead of us?
translation.ja: 〈歴史的な課題に 直面していると―〉 〈気付いているのは 私だけか？〉

translation.en: That this is the moment for Germany to fulfil its destiny?
translation.ja: 〈今こそドイツは 運命を全うする時か？〉

translation.en: Speak. I want you to answer me.
Why aren't they grateful?
The people don't want a war. They're afraid.
translation.ja: 〈国民は戦争を望みません 怖いのです〉

translation.en: The people don't know what they want. They're children.
translation.ja: 〈彼らは何が望みか 分かってない　子供だ〉

translation.en: But you're right. They are afraid. I am surrounded by cowardice.
translation.ja: 〈だが君は正しい 私の周りは臆病者ばかりだ〉

translation.en: Yes, my Führer.
I told you, I can read people.
translation.ja: 〈私は人の心を読めると 言ったろ〉

translation.en: You say yes,
but your eyes…
are saying no.
It's just you and I here.
So…
what are you thinking, von Hartmann?
What do you…
want to say to me?
Nothing.
Heil, my Führer.
I'm told you've signed another agreement with Chamberlain?
translation.ja: 〈チェンバレンと 新たな協定を？〉

translation.en: Don't take that so seriously. That piece of paper is of no significance.
translation.ja: 〈そう騒ぐな 何の意味もない紙切れだ〉

translation.en: The problem lies here, with the German people.
translation.ja: 〈今 問題なのは ドイツ人の方だ〉

translation.en: Anything else?
Thank you.
For…
this.
Thank you.
I hope you don't mind. They asked me to share a ride to the airport.
translation.ja: 構わない？ 空港まで同乗するようにと

translation.en: I'm glad to have a moment alone with you. I haven't been altogether straight with you.
translation.ja: ２人きりになれてよかった あなたに隠してたことが

translation.en: No?
No. I'm actually something of a guardian angel.
translation.ja: 実は私 あなたの守護天使なの

translation.en: What on earth are you talking about?
In London, you asked my surname.
translation.ja: 私の名字を聞いたわね？

translation.en: It's Menzies.
I think you know my uncle. He's a colonel in the Foreign Office.
translation.ja: 外務省に勤めるおじから―

translation.en: Well, he asked me to keep an eye on you out here.
translation.ja: あなたの監視を頼まれた

translation.en: Thank goodness I did.
I took it from your room last night when you went off with your friend.
translation.ja: 昨夜 あなたの部屋から 持ち出した

translation.en: I think other parties were trying to find it this morning?
translation.ja: 今朝 他の連中が捜してた

translation.en: I assume you're waiting for me?
No, actually.
No?
Not today, Paulie. Not today, but soon. Very soon.
translation.ja: 〈今日じゃないが すぐに尻尾をつかんでやる〉

translation.en: Well, then.
- My regards-- - Get out.
Thank you.
Thank you, thank you.
Thank you, thank you, thank you.
translation.ja: 何とお礼を言えばいいか

translation.en: - Thank-- - Enough!
Smoke?
Yes.
Sir.
Sir, we'll be on the ground in half an hour.
My God, I… fell asleep. Ooh.
translation.ja: なんと　眠ってしまった

translation.en: Apparently, there's quite a crowd.
The King has asked you to go direct to Buckingham Palace
translation.ja: 陛下より 宮殿に直行するようにと

translation.en: so their Majesties can thank you in person.
translation.ja: 感謝のお言葉を 頂けるそうです

translation.en: Oh, God.
I shall have to speak to the cameras.
The world doesn't yet know about our joint statement.
translation.ja: 世界は共同声明の件を まだ知らない

translation.en: Prime Minister, I urge you
translation.ja: 首相 ヒトラーとの約束には 細心の注意を払ってください

translation.en: to treat the undertaking given by Hitler with the utmost caution.
translation.ja: ヒトラーとの約束には 細心の注意を払ってください

translation.en: - Ah… - The agreement on the Sudetenland
translation.ja: ズデーテン地方の件以外に…

translation.en: - is one thing, but this other document-- - Yes, I know. Horace, look.
translation.ja: ズデーテン地方の件以外に… 分かってる ホレス

translation.en: If there's one thing I've learned from my dealings with Mr. Hitler,
translation.ja: ヒトラーとの取引で １つ学んだことがある

translation.en: it's that you can't play poker with a gangster without any cards up your sleeve.
translation.ja: 切り札なしにギャングと ポーカーはできない

translation.en: What if he breaks his word? You'll look like a fool.
translation.ja: 彼が約束を破れば恥をかく

translation.en: Well, if he breaks his word, the world will see him for who he truly is!
translation.ja: だが世界は彼の真の姿を知る

translation.en: And it'll unite the Allies. Might even bring the Americans on board.
translation.ja: 連合国側に米国も加わるかも

translation.en: And if I'm made to look a fool, well, it's a small price to pay.
translation.ja: 私が恥をかくだけなら 安いものだ

translation.en: Horace, I can only play the game with the cards I've been dealt.
translation.ja: 私は配られたカードでしか プレイできない

translation.en: What do you think, Legat? Do you think this will change the game?
translation.ja: レガト 状況は変わると思うか？

translation.en: I think there's a chance, Prime Minister.
So do I.
Look at that, Legat.
You'd think we won a war rather than avoided one.
translation.ja: 戦争に勝ったかのようだ

translation.en: There are thousands of people gathering on the Mall.
translation.ja: ザ･マルには 数千人が集まってる

translation.en: Welcome back, sir. Congratulations.
The King intends to take him out onto the balcony.
translation.ja: 首相はバルコニーに立つぞ

translation.en: The settlement of the Czechoslovakian problem,
translation.ja: チェコスロバキアを 巡る問題は―

translation.en: which has been achieved…
…uh, is in my mind
translation.ja: 私の考えでは これは―

translation.en: merely a prelude to a larger settlement,
translation.ja: より包括的な解決策への 序章にすぎません

translation.en: which, for all Europe,
translation.ja: この協定が― 欧州全土に平和を もたらすかもしれない

translation.en: may bring peace.
translation.ja: 欧州全土に平和を もたらすかもしれない

translation.en: For this morning…
this morning I had another talk…
translation.ja: 今朝 ドイツの ヒトラー総統と再度―

translation.en: …with the German Chancellor Herr Hitler.
translation.ja: 話し合いの場を持ちました

translation.en: Here is the paper
which bears his name upon it as well as mine.
translation.ja: 彼の名前と私の名前が 記されています

translation.en: - Hello. -
- Hello. - Hello.
translation.ja: ただいま 待ってた

translation.en: Where's Arthur?
He's in the garden. He'll be happy to see you.
translation.ja: 庭よ　あなたを見たら喜ぶ

translation.en: I'm sorry for the way I left. And, uh…
translation.ja: あんな去り方をして すまなかった

translation.en: I wanted to say…
you were right.
I have felt disappointed.
And it's my fault, not yours.
But there are some things I want to change.
I think I might resign from the service.
And do what?
When war comes, I need to be…
useful.
Don't laugh, but I think I might join the RAF.
What about the treaty? I thought he just said that--
translation.ja: 協定が結ばれたのでは？

translation.en: Just a delay. The PM's given us a chance of winning the damn thing when it happens.
translation.ja: 戦争になっても勝てるよう 時間を稼いだだけだ

translation.en: It's quite some service when you think about it.
But it's coming.
Sooner or later.
One day soon, we will have to fight. And we will have to win.
translation.ja: 負けられない戦いが始まる

translation.en: There must be something else that you can do.
translation.ja: できることはあるはず

translation.en: - More talks, negotiations-- - There's no other way.
Don't say that.
There's always hope.
Yes.
And we'd all be much better off without it.
translation.ja: 希望は持たない方がいい

translation.en: - - Daddy!
Here. Come here. Up a squeak.
Oh, I've missed you.
I could have shot Hitler.
I was so close to him, I could smell his breath.
I could feel the gun in my hand.
But my hand wouldn't move.
Do you know why?
What would give me the right?
Do you want to keep going?
What other choice do we have?
They'll hang you for that one day.
I know.
- ♪ Turn to promises… ♪ - I'll take it.
- ♪ You dream of summer… ♪ - Oh, you speak Russian as well, right?
♪ Of hearing bluebells chime ♪ ♪ Your golden locks ♪ - ♪ Drenched in moonlight… ♪ -
translation.ja: 英独間の和平は １年しか続かなかった

translation.en: ♪ As we watch the birds fly by ♪ ♪ Come dance with me ♪
translation.ja: 厳しい批判を受け チェンバレンは首相を辞任

translation.en: ♪ Into the dark blue night ♪
translation.ja: 厳しい批判を受け チェンバレンは首相を辞任 数か月後に死去した

translation.en: ♪ Into the dark blue night ♪
translation.ja: 連合国側はミュンヘン協定で 稼いだ時間で戦争に備え―

translation.en: ♪ You dream of summer ♪
translation.ja: ロバート･ハリスの 同名小説に基づく
